author: Odeinoichus
title: She has Great Honour
review:
Set #71008 Samurai: We've seen a Samurai before, back during Series 3 a male Samurai was released. Ten series later we have a companion for him, and she looks very impressive.

She has a nice elegant print on her torso with some extra printing on her legs that matches the frontal print on her armour, it's all very nicely done and isn't specifically feminine in design so you can use the torso, legs and armour for MOCing loads of samurai. Even her facial expression isn't overtly feminine, she has a very strong look to her because of this fact. Her hair comes from Series 3, it started being used with the Sumo Wrestler and carried on for many other uses.

I'd strongly recommend her as one of the best figures in the line and you definitely want to pick up a fair number of them for MOC army building.

author: sideswinger
title: Worst in the Series...
review:
LEGO Minifigures Series 13 has a few gender swaps, one of which is the Samurai, a remake of the Series 3 Samurai Warrior, from 2011, which was a pretty weak figure to begin with. This Samurai released in 2015 for 4 dollars, where she includes 8 pieces.

Atop the figure is a hairpiece I always love seeing in CMF's. It was originally introduced in Series 3 with the Sumo Wrestler, but has been reused a few times since then. I still love the moulded detail regarding her bun at the back of the head.

One of the highlights on this character has got to be her armour. It wasn't a new mould, but it features some exclusive printing that looks undeniably pretty good. The moulding on her shoulder-pads are good, though they do jut out slightly too far. The armor was entirely new for the figure in that brick red color. I'm slightly impressed with the torso detailing underneath, which depcits a red robe. The colors work well with the dark gray arms, and the continuation of dark red armor is integrated with the legs.

For accessories, she includes two simple katanas, which are very fitting accessories. They're pretty useful in black.

Overall, this figure is a conondrum for me, because she looks decent enough, she's just a very boring gender swap of an already weak figure. If she brought a new take on the trope, I would be much more generous in my rankings, but unfortunately, she does not. I'm gonna have to give her a 3 out of 5, and she's undoubtedly my least favorite of the set.

Thanks for reading!
